header_summary: Luke Dashjr suggests using SLIPs instead of BIPs for altcoin-related matters and merging BOLTs into BIPs. They propose adding a third BIP editor to handle the workload. The sender questions whether "Ordinals" should be considered a BIP and expresses skepticism about resolving issues with someone named Casey. Peter Todd recommends using "nExpiryHeight" instead of time-based expiration and proposes redefining an opcode. Brandon Black discusses the need for proper evaluation of scripts and the use of OP_MULTISHA256. Antoine Riard and Gleb Naumenko plan to find sustainable fixes for the Lightning Network and seek community interest in their research. They aim to reduce fee-bumping reserve value and locked UTXOs for lightning users. ZmnSCPxj explains a core attack on the Lightning Network.

recent_posts.title: Ordinals BIP PR
recent_posts.summary:
- The email discusses the concept of BIPs and their relevance in Bitcoin software.
- The sender proposes merging BOLTs into BIPs and suggests having a third BIP editor.
- There is a debate on the relevance of certain clauses in BIP 2 that need resolution.

recent_posts.title: OP_Expire and Coinbase-Like Behavior: Making HTLCs Safer by Letting Transactions Expire Safely
recent_posts.summary:
- The email suggests using "nExpiryHeight" instead of time-based expiration to avoid issues.
- The sender proposes redefining an opcode and suggests alternative names like OP_Expire or OP_CheckExpiryTime.
- The use of "nExpiryHeight" is considered useful, especially for cases where a signature covers the field.

recent_posts.title: Examining ScriptPubkeys in Bitcoin Script
recent_posts.summary:
- Brandon Black discusses the use of scripts and the need for proper evaluation.
- Writing scripts without iteration makes it difficult to evaluate N-input but could provide insights into OP_TXHASH input selection.
- OP_MULTISHA256 is almost as powerful as OP_CAT and using OP_2SHA256 for CScriptNum generation would be a premature optimization.

recent_posts.title: OP_Expire and Coinbase-Like Behavior: Making HTLCs Safer by Letting Transactions Expire Safely
recent_posts.summary:
- The email suggests using "nExpiryHeight" instead of time-based expiration in programming.
- The sender proposes redefining an OP_SuccessX opcode and suggests alternative names for it.
- The sender acknowledges their mistake and suggests having a separate field like nExpiryHeight.

recent_posts.title: On solving pinning, replacement cycling and mempool issues for bitcoin second-layers
recent_posts.summary:
- Gleb Naumenko and the sender plan to research sustainable fixes for the Lightning Network.
- They have studied cross-layer issues since 2019/2020 and gained practical experience in bitcoin core and rust-lightning codebases.
- They seek assistance from Elichai Turkel and emphasize the need for community interest and involvement.

recent_posts.title: Full Disclosure: CVE-2023-40231 / CVE-2023-40232 / CVE-2023-40233 / CVE-2023-40234 "All your	mempool are belong to us"
recent_posts.summary:
- ZmnSCPxj explains a core attack on the Lightning Network involving nodes A, B, and C.
- The attack occurs when node A routes an HTLC to B and B forwards it to C.
- Node C can feebump the HTLC-success transaction, giving it an advantage over node B.

active_posts.title: Full Disclosure: CVE-2023-40231 / CVE-2023-40232 / CVE-2023-40233 / CVE-2023-40234 "All your mempool are belong to us"
active_posts.summary:
- Replacement cycling attack targeting lightning channels can lead to fund loss.
- Major lightning implementations have implemented mitigations to prevent this attack.
- Developers of other bitcoin applications should investigate potential disruption caused by these attacks.

active_posts.title: Proposed BIP for OP_CAT
active_posts.summary:
- A draft BIP proposes enabling OP_CAT as a Tapscript opcode with a maximum stack size of 520 Bytes.
- OP_CAT allows concatenation of two values on the stack, expanding tapscript functionality.
- Use cases include tree signatures, logical spend conditions, and non-equivocation contracts in tapscript.

active_posts.title: Batch exchange withdrawal to lightning requires covenants
active_posts.summary:
- The email proposes a protocol using covenants to withdraw funds from exchanges into lightning wallets efficiently.
- The current method shifts the burden of on-chain transactions to the user's wallet provider.
- A workaround using `SIGHASH_SINGLE | SIGHASH_ANYONECANPAY` is suggested, but it introduces a potential blackmail issue.

active_posts.title: Full Disclosure: CVE-2023-40231 / CVE-2023-40232 / CVE-2023-40233 / CVE-2023-40234 "All your mempool are belong to us"
active_posts.summary:
- The replacement cycling attack poses a risk to lightning channels and Bitcoin applications.
- Major lightning implementations have implemented mitigations, but other applications may be affected.
- Developers and operators should investigate potential disruptions and assess vulnerabilities caused by these attacks.

active_posts.title: Batch exchange withdrawal to lightning requires covenants
active_posts.summary:
- The sender discusses designing a protocol for lightning withdrawals using covenants.
- The current method of lightning withdrawals shifts the burden to the user's wallet provider.
- The `SIGHASH_ANYPREVOUT` covenant resolves the challenge by allowing anyprevout signatures.

active_posts.title: Removing channel reserve for mobile wallet users
active_posts.summary:
- The email suggests removing the channel reserve requirement for channels between wallet users and providers.
- The reserve leads to capital inefficiency and a confusing user experience.
- The author proposes that providers pay on-chain fees and users use penalty transactions instead.
